QUOTATIONS.Definition: phrases or passages of writings from a book

PROHIBITION.Definition: the act of officially not allowing something

BANNING.Definition: the act of officially not allowing something

CENSORSHIP.Definition: the act of not allowing books or parts of books because they are unacceptable to some people

ELITE.Definition: the richest and most powerful group in a society

BOARD.Definition: an organised body that takes decisions for an organisation

A BADGE OF SHAME.Definition: something that shows that someone has done something wrong

APARTHEID.Definition: a political system in South Africa in which people were separated based on the colour of their skin

EXCEPTIONS.Definition: things that are not included in a general list

PERSECUTE.Definition: treat someone in a bad way because of their beliefs, race etc.

PROPHECY.Definition: a statement that says what is going to happen in the future

INDULGENCES.Definition: papers sold by the church which forgave the sins of the buyer

FORMS.Definition: documents with blank spaces to be filled with the details of the buyer

PERSONALISED.Definition: marked with the name of the owner

FORGIVENESS.Definition: the act of excusing or forgiving a sin

ABUSE.Definition: use something for the wrong purpose

NAILED.Definition: attached or fastened with a nail

CLERGY.Definition: people with a religious rank, the priests

TURBO-CHARGING.Definition: making it more powerful and fast

LITERACY.Definition: the ability to read and write

BENEFICIARIES.Definition: people who receive advantages as a result of something

UNORTHODOX.Definition: different from what is expected or considered normal

SPREADING.Definition: making an idea reach more people

OVERLAP.Definition: cover parts of the same areas

TOTALITARIAN.Definition: of a political system with absolute power and complete control

DISSENT.Definition: refusal to accept the opinions and policies of authority

GULAG.Definition: work prisons for people who expressed different to the authority's political opinions

BADGE OF HONOUR.Definition: something that shows that someone has done something important

BOARDS.Definition: organised bodies that takes decisions for an organisation

CENSORED.Definition: the act of not allowing books or parts of books because they are unacceptable to some people

PROSECUTED.Definition: was led to be tried in a court of Law

OBSCENITY.Definition: unaccepted behaviour that upsets and offends people

PROSECUTION.Definition: the act of starting a legal case against someone

JURY.Definition: a group of people that judge a trial

DEGENERACY.Definition: the state of having very low standards of behaviour

CENSORS.Definition: people whose job is to examine books in order to remove what is considered unaccepted

NARRATOR.Definition: the character that tells what is happening in a book

SWEARS.Definition: uses rude, insulting and upsetting words

CULT.Definition: something that is popular among a particular group of society

URBAN MYTH.Definition: a story which many people believe but which is not true

BLASPHEMOUS.Definition: showing no respect to a god or religion

PROPHET.Definition: someone who is believed to have the power to say what will happen in the future

POINTLESS.Definition: without meaning, a waste of time

CENSOR.Definition: ban a part of a book or a book because it is considered unaccepted
